alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 6:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cascade County through 700 PM MDT... At 614 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Sun River to 30 miles south of Great Falls. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rainfall is likely for a short period of time as this storm moves through. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Eden, Stockett, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Ulm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains
